wikipedia_page.main:
Lieutenant Colonel John Henry Stephen Dimmer  (9 October 1883 – 21 March 1918) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.
Born on 9 October 1883, Dimmer was educated at Rutlish School, Merton Park, south London.  Aged 31, married and a lieutenant in the 2nd Battalion, The King's Royal Rifle Corps, he was awarded the VC for his actions on 12 November 1914 at Klein Zillebeke, Belgium.

response: *Lieutenant Colonel John Henry Stephen Dimmer, 2nd Battalion, KRRC (First World War)
